quote.text: If Heat and The Departed had a baby, the result might come close to The Town, a riveting and explosive crime thriller and one of the year's best pictures.
...a rich, dark, pulpy mess of entanglements that fulfills all the requirements of the genre
...an effective thriller...
...the well-acted, suspenseful story deals in fascinatingly murky morality and mines intriguing material from a historic and complex city.
Might Hamm get George Clooney's career? This movie can't hurt.
Crime hasn't looked this cool in a while.
...is more indebted to life than movies. A triumph.
...has got bangs, bucks and the kind of showy, signature roles aspiring actors pantomime themselves asleep to at night.
...is that rare beast, a grown-up genre flick, chock-full of compelling character dynamics and a clutch of pitch-perfect performances.
At the end of the day, The Town is an excellent film. This is one of those cases where the film alone is worth the purchase price.
With a crisp, clear style and a focus on character, director Ben Affleck is able to imbue staple action scenes with a sense of urgency and tension.
As crime dramas go, The Town is a solid take on a tried-and-true genre with sly touches of dark humor that offer a satisfying sense of levity.
There are clam-chowder accents and Fighting Irish tattoos aplenty...
...a gripping human drama disguised as a blazing heist film that comes on like gangbusters.
...kills a couple hours with less pain than most studio genre fare...
A capably done, contemporary, meat-and-potatoes heist yarn wrapped around a major romantic complication.

award.name: Academy Awards
award.nominee-description: Nominated for Best Actor in a Supporting Role

details.name: Best Actor in a Supporting Role
